review.title: Bio-Inspired Human Action Recognition using Hybrid Max-Product Neuro-Fuzzy Classifier and Quantum-Behaved PSO
review.abstract: Studies on computational neuroscience through functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) and following biological inspired system stated that human action recognition in the brain of mammalian leads two distinct pathways in the model, which are specialized for analysis of motion (optic flow) and form information. Principally, we have defined a novel and robust form features applying active basis model as form extractor in form pathway in the biological inspired model. An unbalanced synergetic neural net-work classifies shapes and structures of human objects along with tuning its attention parameter by quantum particle swarm optimization (QPSO) via initiation of Centroidal Voronoi Tessellations. These tools utilized and justified as strong tools for following biological system model in form pathway. But the final decision has done by combination of ultimate outcomes of both pathways via fuzzy inference which increases novality of proposed model. Combination of these two brain pathways is done by considering each feature sets in Gaussian membership functions with fuzzy product inference method. Two configurations have been proposed for form pathway: applying multi-prototype human action templates using two time synergetic neural network for obtaining uniform template regarding each actions, and second scenario that it uses abstracting human action in four key-frames. Experimental results showed promising accuracy performance on different datasets (KTH and Weizmann).

sections.heading: 3.2 Motion features.
sections.text: A mask that reveals the visibility of the individual layers is the main difference between estimating the traditional and layer-by-layer optical flow. The mask shape is able to perform fractal and arbitrary adjustments and applies only to the pixels that fall into the mask (see [4]). We use the layer-by-layer optical flow method in [4], which has an optical flow algorithm of [26, 27, 28]. For an overview, M1 and M2 are visible masks for two frames I1 (t) and I2 (t-1), the flow field from I1 to I2 and I2 to I1 are represented by (u1, v1, v2), (u2, v2). The following terms are considered for layer-by-layer optical flow estimation: The objective function consists of three parts, visible layer masks that coincide with these two images, whereby Gausmetsian, the immetric data (E) and Matching (E) are considered.

sections.heading: 4.5 Evaluation of Quantum-Behaved
sections.text: Particle Swarm Optimization Results have previously mentioned are in balanced mode of synergetic neural network which has been done for better comparison between both scenarios of form path, while using quantum particle swarm optimization has very good tuning performance for attention parameters. Attention parameter in balance mode is constant and equal to one. While a method is working to find the solution to the present problem, one of the most significant problems is how to select its parameters and trigger them. Centroidal Voronoi tessellations were used for the first attention parameter. The value of _ is constant and static. The algorithm runs for 500 echoes for 20 particles as population size and 20 times.

sections.heading: 4.6 Evaluation
sections.text: After the convergence of the algorithm, attention parameters in unbalanced synergetic neural networks were used for the results of the mold path. Evaluation of the proposed approach by two human action datasets has already taken place and confusion matrices have already been shown. At this point, we show the performance of the proposed method compared to previous approaches on the same dataset as in Table 1 and Table 2. The proposed methodological performances on KTH and Weizmann datasets are state-of-the-art and achieve good and comparable results. Comparing our asbiologically inspired model with the current state of the art (with or without biological point of view) listed in Table 1 and Table 2, it should also be noted that different methods listed in Table 1 show all possible variations in their experimental arrangements, e.g. different splits of training / test data, whether pre-processing (e.g. tracking, background subtraction) is necessary, are comparable with or not comparable with video acquisition classes, whether several acoustic classes can be performed with one another.

metadata.abstractText: following biological inspired system stated that human action recognition in the brain of mammalian leads two distinct pathways in the model, which are specialized for analysis of motion (optic flow) and form information. Principally, we have defined a novel and robust form features applying active basis model as form extractor in form pathway in the biological inspired model. An unbalanced synergetic neural net-work classifies shapes and structures of human objects along with tuning its attention parameter by quantum particle swarm optimization (QPSO) via initiation of Centroidal Voronoi Tessellations. These tools utilized and justified as strong tools for following biological system model in form pathway. But the final decision has done by combination of ultimate outcomes of both pathways via fuzzy inference which increases novality of proposed model. Combination of these two brain pathways is done by considering each feature sets in Gaussian membership functions with fuzzy product inference method. Two configurations have been proposed for form pathway: applying multi-prototype human action templates using two time synergetic neural network for obtaining uniform template regarding each actions, and second scenario that it uses abstracting human action in four key-frames. Experimental results showed promising accuracy performance on different datasets (KTH and Weizmann).
